histogram.name: Security.CertificateTransparency.MainFrameNavigationCompliance
histogram.summary: The compliance of each main frame navigation's connection with the Certificate Transparency policy. Recorded whenever a main-frame, non-same-page navigation is committed. Connections can be compliant, or they can be non-compliant for one of several reasons (not enough Signed Certificate Timestamps [SCTs], not diverse enough SCTs, or the build was old so CT compliance wasn't checked).

histogram.name: Security.ClientAuth.CertificateSelectionSource
histogram.summary: When TLS client authentication is requested by the server, Chrome must choose whether to return a certificate or to abort the handshake. This histogram records how this determination was made, either as a result of user action, or as chosen automatically due to content settings. It only records when a fresh certificate selection would be attempted (and thus ignores cache hits). This histogram is recorded in SSLClientAuthObserver for user-selected outcomes and in ChromeContentBrowserClient for policy outcomes. This histogram does not cover mobile, as certificate handling is not handled by Chrome on Android nor iOS.

histogram.name: Security.LegacyTLS.DownloadStarted
histogram.summary: Records whether the page would have a legacy TLS warning (if the user were in the appropriate field trial) when a download is initiated from the page (*not* the legacy TLS status of the download URL itself). This is recorded regardless of whether the warning is actually displayed. This histogram is not recorded for downloads that are initiated in a new tab or window, as the legacy TLS status of the initiating page cannot be tracked.

histogram.name: Security.LegacyTLS.FormSubmission
histogram.summary: Records whether the page would have a legacy TLS warning (if the user were in the appropriate field trial) when submitting a form. This is recorded whenever a form submission navigation begins. The recorded status is of the page the form was submitted from, not the one that the form targets.

histogram.name: Security.LegacyTLS.OnCommit
histogram.summary: Records whether the page would have a legacy TLS warning (if the user were in the appropriate field trial) when the navigation to the page commits.

histogram.name: Security.LegacyTLS.PageInfo.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions along with whether the page would have a legacy TLS warning (if the user were in the appropriate field trial).

histogram.name: Security.MixedForm.InterstitialTriggerState
histogram.summary: Logs when an interstitial was triggered (or would have been triggered but was not due to the currently enabled experiment mode) and whether it was a direct submission to an insecure URL, or a redirect through one.

histogram.name: Security.PageEndReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason the page visit ended (e.g., reload, tab closed, new navigation, etc.) for page loads that committed.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Dangerous
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on an HTTPS URL that has been marked dangerous or not secure (such as for malware or broken HTTPS).

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Downgraded
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on a valid HTTPS URL that has a security issue (e.g. mixed content).

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.ValidEV
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on a valid HTTPS URL with no security issues (e.g. no mixed content) and an Extended Validation Certificate.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.ValidNonEV
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on a valid HTTPS URL with no security issues (e.g. no mixed content), but no Extended Validation Certificate.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpUrl.Dangerous
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on an HTTP URL that has been marked dangerous (such as for malware).

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpUrl.Neutral
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on an HTTP URL that does not have an omnibox security indicator warning associated with it.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpUrl.Warning
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on an HTTP URL that has been given a "Not secure" warning in the omnibox.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.TimeOpen
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the Page Info bubble is open before the user closes it or takes an action which closes it.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.TimeOpen.Action
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the Page Info bubble is open before the user closes it, for cases where the user has performed an action inside it.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.TimeOpen.NoAction
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the Page Info bubble is open before the user closes it, for cases where the user performed no action inside it.

histogram.name: Security.PasswordEntry.SiteEngagementLevel
histogram.summary: Site engagement level of the URL of the top frame of the navigation when the user modifies a password field on the page. Only recorded once per navigation for the top frame.

histogram.name: Security.PasswordFocus.SiteEngagementLevel
histogram.summary: Site engagement level of the URL of the top frame of the navigation when the user focuses on a password field on the page. Only recorded once per navigation for the top frame.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.DownloadStarted
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status on a page that initiated a download (*not* the Safety Tip status of the download URL itself). This is recorded regardless of whether the Safety Tip UI is enabled or disabled. This histogram is not recorded for downloads that are initiated in a new tab or window, as the Safety Tip status of the initiating page cannot be tracked.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.FormSubmission
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page when submitting a form. This histogram is recorded whenever a form submission navigation begins. The recorded safety tip status is the status of the page the form was submitted from, not the one that the form targets. Recorded regardless of whether the Safety Tip UI is enabled or disabled.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.Interaction
histogram.summary: Records a user's interaction with a Safety Tip. Recorded every time a user uses one of the Safety Tip's buttons or dismisses it explicitly. Can be normalized against Security.SafetyTips.SafetyTipShown, filtered to users with the feature enabled to show the UI.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.CloseTab
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user closed the tab.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.Dismiss
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user explicitly closed the bubble. This is recorded in addition to the more specifc metric that indicates how the user dismissed the Safety Tip.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.DismissWithClose
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user explicitly closed the bubble with the close button. This is recorded in addition to the base dismiss metric.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.DismissWithEsc
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user explicitly closed the bubble with the esc key. This is recorded in addition to the base dismiss metric.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.DismissWithIgnore
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user explicitly closed the bubble with the ignore button. This is recorded in addition to the base dismiss metric.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.LeaveSite
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user closed the bubble by heeding the call-to-action to leave the site.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.NoAction
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user did not dismiss or take action in the bubble.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.StartNewNavigation
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user started a new navigation in the same tab.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.OpenTime.SwitchTab
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time a Safety Tip bubble is open, for cases where the user switched tabs.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.PageInfo.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions along with the Safety Tip status of the page.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.ReputationCheckComplete
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit or page visibility change. This is the same as SafetyTipShown, but with additional suffixes for clarity.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.SafetyTipIgnoredPageLoad
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit for a page where the Safety Tip has previously been ignored.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.SafetyTipShown
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit or page visibility change.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.SafetyTipShown_AfterFlag
histogram.summary: TEMPORARY histogram that records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit or page visibility change. This is the same as SafetyTipShown, but records *after* the flag is checked to evaluate the impact of starts_active.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.StatusWithInitiator.{SafetyTipInitiator}
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit, alongside how the corresponding navigation was initiated. Only recorded on navigations that were visible at commit time.

variant.name: SameRegDomain
variant.summary: Initiated by the same registered domain

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.CacheHWM
histogram.summary: Records the high-water-mark of the number of reports in the SCT auditing cache size over each browser session. Recorded when the SCT auditing cache is destroyed (normally during browser shutdown, and potentially if the network service crashes).

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportDeduplicated
histogram.summary: Records whether a report was deduplicated (i.e., the SCTs were already in the cache) or not. Recorded on each new report seen by the SCT auditing cache (i.e., on each connection using certificate transparency).

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportSampled
histogram.summary: Records whether a report was sampled to be sent to Safe Browsing. Recorded for each new report seen by the SCT auditing cache that was not deduplicated.

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of an SCT auditing report that will be sent to Safe Browsing (i.e., was not deduplicated and was sampled).

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportSucceeded
histogram.summary: Records whether sending an SCT auditing report succeeded or not. This is recorded after we receive the headers from the server (or we stop due to a connection error).

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.CryptographicScheme
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page with a cryptographic scheme (e.g. https). This histogram is recorded once at navigation commit time, and can be called again for the same document if the security level changes dynamically. Note that the security level can change very quickly after commit time, for example if the page includes mixed content on load (which can downgrade the security level). This histogram should be analyzed with care because each recorded security level is not necessarily user-visible: in particular, a page may commit as a secure level (SECURE, EV_SECURE, SECURE_WITH_POLICY_INSTALLED_CERT) but get quickly downgraded to NONE if it shows mixed content on load. Therefore the histogram values should be regarded as an upper-bound on what the user actually sees for these security levels.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.DownloadStarted
histogram.summary: Records the security level of the page that initiated a download (rather than the security state of the connection to the download URL itself). The recorded security level is the level of the page the download was initiated from, not that of the download URL. This histogram is not recorded for downloads that are initiated in a new tab or window, as the security level of the initiating page cannot be tracked.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.FormSubmission
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page when submitting a form. This histogram is recorded whenever a form submission navigation begins. The recorded security level is the level of the page the form was submitted from, not the one that the form targets.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.InsecureMainFrameFormSubmission
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page when submitting a form on a top-frame navigation with a non-cryptographic scheme. This histogram is recorded whenever a form submission navigation begins. The recorded security level is the level of the page the form was submitted from, not the one that the form targets.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.InsecureMainFrameNonFormNavigation
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page on top-frame navigations with a non-cryptographic scheme that are not form submissions. This histogram is compared against Security.SecurityLevel.InsecureMainFrameFormSubmission.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.NoncryptographicScheme
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page with a non-cryptographic scheme (e.g. http). This histogram is recorded once at navigation commit time, and can be called again for the same document if the security level changes dynamically. Note that the security level can change very quickly after commit time, for example if the page includes a password field on load (which can downgrade the security level). This histogram should be analyzed with care because each recorded security level is not necessarily user-visible: in particular, a page may commit as NONE or WARNING but get quickly downgraded to WARNING or DANGEROUS, depending on field trial configuration, if it shows a password field on load. Therefore the histogram values should be regarded as an upper-bound on what the user actually sees for the NONE and WARNING levels.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.OnCommit
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page at the time the navigation commits. Note that the security level of a page can change after commit time, so this histogram should often be compared against Security.SecurityLevel.OnComplete.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.OnComplete
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page at the end of the page visit (i.e., navigating away from the page, reloading the page, clicking a link, closing the tab, etc.). Note that this security level can be different than the initial security level of the page, so this histogram should often be compared against Security.SecuritLevel.OnCommit.

histogram.name: Security.SiteEngagement
histogram.summary: The final Site Engagement score (0 to 100) of a URL during a visit to a page. Recorded when the user closes the page or initiates a new navigation.

histogram.name: Security.SiteEngagementDelta
histogram.summary:
The change in Site Engagement score for a site between the page navigation committing and the user closing the page or navigating away. Recorded when the user closes the page or initiates a new navigation.
The delta is logged as a linear count in [0, 100]. To use, convert back to the original difference (in the range [-100,100]) by multiplying by 2 and subtracting 100.

histogram.name: Security.TimeOnPage2
histogram.summary: Records the time spent on the page (the time that the page was in the foreground from the start of the navigation to the page visit completing due to a new navigation or the tab being closed). This aggregates all foreground time over the entire visit (multiple times in the foreground are added together).

histogram.name: Security.XFrameOptions
histogram.summary: Record uses of the X-Frame-Options header when a page is loaded as an iframe.
